{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3546723,"name":"","username":"CalculusPenguin","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/838e76/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-04T00:17:23.873Z","cooked":"

Hello,

We are trying to get a usb camera to show up on shuffleboard. I used CameraServer.startAutomaticCapture(); to start the camera, and also tried CameraServer.putVideo("cam", 640, 480); (only after the former didn’t work). They both showed up on shuffleboard, but when we dragged them to show as camera server the camera was blacked out. The network table for the camera did also showed up, with the connected boolean checking out (true when it was connected, false when we unplugged the camera). We are using a Microsoft lifecam, which works in google meets/when connected to a computer.

Any ideas?

Just discovered the camera stream works in the default dashboard, but not shuffleboard. My shuffleboard is up-to-date and updates numbers and booleans. I would like to use it this season, why is it not working with cameras?

What is the exact version?

I do not have an answer to your question; but know that shuffleboard has been unmaintained for quite sometime and is scheduled to be depreciated.

It may behove you to migrate over to any number of other alternatives as effort/work to make shuffleboard operational for you is long-term fruitless.

Elastic or QFRCDashboard are your best options. Elastic is included with WPILib so you won’t need any extra installation. I can’t speak on QFRCDashboard because I’m the developer of it and would thus be biased (there’s a reef display widget though). Check out their relevant threads for more info.

Elastic 2025: A Lot of Little Things Programming
[Elastic Logo] I’m happy to begin initial 2025 beta testing for Elastic. For those who aren’t familiar with Elastic, it’s a Flutter driver dashboard that acts as a drop in replacement for Shuffleboard, with a nicer UI, network optimizations, and more customizability. Elastic was initially released last year, and I was blown away by the community response. [2025 Demo Layout] What Changed? Overall, not much on the outside. The interface and UX is extremely similar, but the differences lie in …
QFRCDashboard 2025: a performant, reliable, aesthetic driver dashboard Technical
QFRCDashboard is officially ready for the 2025 season! QFRCDashboard is an extremely lightweight, high-performance dashboard, designed to be aesthetically pleasing & easy to look at during a match, all while taking up as few driver station resources as possible. [image] Performance QFRCDashboard utilizes the very high efficiency & low resource cost of the Qt framework and its QML GUI to ensure that as many resources can be allocated to the driver station app as possible. Additionally, widget…

I assume you are plugging the camera into a roboRIO. If not, then likely you plugged it into a laptop and the lid is closed so the camera is black and you’ll have to pick a different camid (0, 1, etc.) to get the other camera (default camid depends on if the camera was connected or not when the PC booted). You can try setting the exposure higher either in your code or on the “web” interface port 1181. Another possibility is something wrong with the roboRIO USB port.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2025-03-04T15:00:19.968Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":72,"readers_count":71,"score":19.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":494111,"topic_slug":"usb-camera-through-shuffleboard","display_username":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24594,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/usb-camera-through-shuffleboard/494111/7","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3548067,"name":"David Lame","username":"David_Lame","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/51bf81/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-05T08:32:37.648Z","cooked":"

I found this thread through search because I have a similar problem.

In my case, I am using PhotonVision, with the camera plugged into a USB port on the Raspberry Pi. It is set to “driver mode”. I can see the stream either on the PhotonVision client, or by opening up port 1182 of the Raspberry Pi in a browser window. Under network tables, I can see the PhotonVision menu entry, and I can get data through it. Using PhotonLib, if the camera is in “driver mode”, the PhotonPipelineResult sees no targets. As soon as I switch it to running an AprilTag pipeline, it reports, correctly that targets are present.

In sumary, the camera is working. It is sending a stream on port 1182.

But ShuffleBoard doesn’t show any sources under cameraserver.

Just to make it slightly more confusing, it worked when we were using a Microsoft Lifecam, but when we switched that out for an Arducam 9281, our streams vanished. If it weren’t for the fact that I can see the stream on port 1182, I would suspect camera incompatibility, but I would assume that if it can send a stream on the port, that stream ought to be picked up on the other end.

I suppose Elastic is the next step. I notice that “Elastic” isn’t an option on the driver station. Off to the documentation…

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2025-03-05T08:32:37.648Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":58,"readers_count":57,"score":16.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":494111,"topic_slug":"usb-camera-through-shuffleboard","display_username":"David Lame","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":24594,"username":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","name":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/slab-mr.thomas/{size}/182153_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24723,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/usb-camera-through-shuffleboard/494111/8","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3548130,"name":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","username":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/slab-mr.thomas/{size}/182153_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-05T13:11:17.210Z","cooked":"

All the WPILib Tools are in the folder that is installed with VSCode, etc. 2025 WPILib Tools.

I don’t have a setup with me to verfiy this but I remember something about a LimeLight shows up in two places on the NetworkWork tables as seen by Elastic. This might apply to PV, too. If you drag and drop from one place, the image is fixed at somewhat small. If you drag and drop from the other place you see the camera, the image size can be adjusted.

The difference between the LifeCam and ArduCam could be their formats of YUYV vs MJPEG.
